availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Floyd County, Kentucky, attorney, soldier, and politician. Scott County, Virginia, native. Son of John Lloyd Elliott and Jane Ritchie Elliott. Married to Susan J. Smith Elliott in 1848. Graduate of Emory and Henry College in Emory, Virginia. Admitted to the bar in 1843. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1847 and 1861. Attorney in Floyd County in 1850. Member of the Sixth Congressional District of Kentucky of the United States House of Representatives from March 4, 1853, to March 3, 1859. Indicted for treason in 1861. Expelled from the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from December 21, 1861, for connection to the Confederate Army. Private in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.). Delegate to the Provisional Confederate Congress in 1862. Member of the Twelfth Congressional District of the First and Second Confederate Congresses in the U. S. House of Representatives from 1862 to 1865. Chairman of the Committee on Enrolled Bills in the First Congress. Member of the Democratic Party.
